title-part.text: INDEXING SCHEME ASSOCIATED WITH SUBLASSES OF SECTION D, RELATING TO TEXTILES

note.note-paragraph: This subclass constitutes a scheme for indexing only.

The indexing codes of this subclass, relating to the chemical constitution of the fibrous materials, are to be associated with groups of section D, with the exception of those of subclass D06M, as far as these groups themselves do not give information about the chemical nature of the fibres.

In a number of fields, the indexing codes relating to the chemical constitution of the fibrous materials are not allotted to documents having an abstract in which the chemical constitution is clearly stated, e.g. if the abstract mentions "polyamide", code D10B2331/021 is not allotted.
Blends of fibres are indexed according to each constituent fibre.

title-part.text: based on oxides or oxide ceramics, e.g. silicates
based on non-oxides other than metals
Cellulose esters or ethers, e.g. cellulose acetate
Natural animal fibres, e.g. keratin fibres
Fibres made from polymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
high-strength or high-molecular-weight polyethylene, e.g. dyneema, spectra
polymers of fluorinated hydrocarbons, e.g. polytetrafluoroethene (PTFE)
polymers of unsaturated alcohols, e.g. polyvinyl alcohol, or of their acetals or ketals
polymers of unsaturated carboxylic acids or unsaturated organic esters, e.g. polyacrylic esters, polyvinyl acetate
polymers of unsaturated nitriles, e.g. polyacrylonitrile, polyvinylidene cyanide
polymers of cyclic compounds with one carbon-to-carbon double bond in the side chain
Fibres made from polymers obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds, e.g. polycondensation products
derived from hydroxy-carboxylic acids, e.g. lactones
polycondensates of cyclic compounds, e.g. polyimides, polybenzimidazoles
polycondensation products not covered by indexing codes D10B2331/02 to D10B2331/14
protective against sunlight or UV radiation
Details of fabric structure established in the fabric forming process
One hairy surface, e.g. napped or raised

reference.text: for pile fabrics D03D27/00, D04B1/02, D04B21/02

title-part.text: One smooth surface, e.g. laminated or coated
One surface including hollow piping or integrated straps, e.g. for inserts or mountings
with one or more yarns appearing predominantly on one face, e.g. plated or paralleled yarns

reference.text: for pile fabrics D03D27/00, D04B1/02, D04B21/02; for intarsia fabrics D04B1/126

title-part.text: Two hairy surfaces, e.g. napped or raised

reference.text: for pile fabrics D03D27/00, D04B1/02, D04B21/02

title-part.text: Smooth surfaces, e.g. laminated or coated
Both surfaces including hollow piping or integrated straps, e.g. for inserts or mountings
Lofty fabric with equidistantly spaced front and back plies, e.g. spacer fabrics
with apertures, e.g. with one or more mesh fabric plies
Lofty fabric with variably spaced front and back plies, e.g. spacer fabrics
with at least one corrugated ply
with at least one baggy or puckered ply
with apertures, e.g. with one or more mesh fabric plies
Fabric with at least two, predominantly unlinked, knitted or woven plies interlaced with each other at spaced locations or linked to a common internal co-extensive yarn system
including contracting yarn, e.g. blister fabrics
with a single array of unbent yarn, e.g. unidirectional reinforcement fabrics
including several arrays of unbent yarn, e.g. multiaxial fabrics
containing particulate matter, e.g. powder or granulate
with electronic components, e.g. sensors or switches
Small thickness fabric, e.g. ribbons, tapes or straps
Flat fabric of variable width, e.g. including one or more fashioned panels

Three dimensional fabric, e.g. forming or comprising cavities in or protrusions from the basic planar configuration, or deviations from the cylindrical shape as generally imposed by the fabric forming process
with one or more convex or concave portions of limited extension, e.g. domes or pouches
with gussets folding into three dimensional shape, e.g. seat covers
with tubular portions of variable diameter or distinct axial orientation
Stiffening bandages, e.g. with plaster of Paris
Elastic support stockings or elastic bandages
